overview: This measure, in its final conference draft form, finalizes the Judiciary's budget for the 2025-2027 biennium by appropriating general funds of $201,725,676 for FY 2025-2026 and $199,579,345 for FY 2026-2027. The bill's capital improvement appropriations remain consistent with the previous version at $12,900,000. A key change is the updated effective date to July 1, 2025, ensuring the appropriations are enacted for the upcoming fiscal period.
appropriations: The final version of the bill increases the Judiciary's operating budget from the amounts passed by the Senate Committee on Ways and Means. General fund appropriations are now set at $201,725,676 for fiscal year 2025-2026 and $199,579,345 for fiscal year 2026-2027. Total appropriations from all means of finance are finalized at $214,571,429 for FY 2025-2026 and $212,425,098 for FY 2026-2027.
agency_impact: The finalized budget provides the Judiciary with increased general fund resources for the biennium compared to the previous version, supporting operational needs across all judicial circuits and administrative divisions. This allows the agency to proceed with its planned expenditures and confirms the authorized position ceilings for permanent and temporary staff. The Judiciary is now cleared to implement its budget as of the new effective date.
policy_impact: The most significant policy change in this final version is the amendment of the effective date to July 1, 2025. This replaces the previous defective date of July 1, 2050, which was intended to facilitate further legislative negotiation. The new, non-defective effective date signifies that the legislature has reached a final agreement and intends for the appropriations to be implemented for the specified fiscal biennium.
six_year_fiscal_implications: The operating budget baseline for the Judiciary has been increased from the amounts cited in the previous version. The new general fund figures are $201,725,676 for FY 2025-2026 and $199,579,345 for FY 2026-2027. These updated amounts will serve as the new baseline for projecting the Judiciary's operating costs in subsequent fiscal years. This represents an increase of approximately $2.94 million in the first year and $0.72 million in the second year over the previously reported Senate Ways and Means Committee version. The capital improvement project funding and its associated debt service implications remain unchanged from the previous fiscal note. All other provisions related to the transfer of funds and management of federal funds are standard for an appropriations act. The bill does not introduce new programs with long-term cost drivers beyond the established operational and capital funding.
updates_from_previous_fiscal_note: This final version of the bill, as detailed in Conference Committee Report 157, finalizes the Judiciary's operating budget with increased general fund appropriations of $201,725,676 for FY 2025-2026 and $199,579,345 for FY 2026-2027. While the capital improvement funding of $12,900,000 is unchanged, the most significant update is the change of the bill's effective date from a defective one to July 1, 2025, making the budget effective for the biennium.
